description: ACEFs, or household economic cooperatives, help low-income individuals with budgeting and debt avoidance and also advocate for consumer rights. Three ways they do this are by
activities: Three ways they do this are by:; Advising individuals on how to prepare and apply a budget, and following up to help with any debt problems they may encounter.; Offering courses, information sessions, awareness and prevention tools on budgeting issues, including credit, debt reduction, money savings tips and more.; In some cases, creating mutual aid funds that help people with low incomes to obtain small interest-free loans.

description: Promote the integration of immigrant parents and their young children in the Saint-Michel district through outreach, support and mediation services provided by women community outreach workers, while fostering the empowerment of project participants.
activities: Recruitment and training of women community outreach workers, outreach, referral, support for families, language and cultural interpretation.

description: Volunteer action centres promote volunteering and recruit, train and coordinate volunteers in their respective territories.
activities: Centraide of Greater Montreal supports 17 agencies and points of service that promote volunteering.

org_name: " Action-autonomie " - Le collectif pour la dÃ©fense des droits en santÃ© mentale de MontrÃ©al
description: Help persons with mental health problems by advocating their rights, improving their quality of life, building their self-reliance and facilitating their social integration.

org_name: Action-Gardien, table de concertation communautaire de Pointe-Saint-Charles

They bring together local social stakeholders, coordinate the establishment of various projects, and support the community agencies with their intervention strategies.

org_name: Action-Gardien, table de concertation communautaire de Pointe-Saint-Charles - Mobilisation citoyenne OPA
description: Bring the residents of Pointe-Saint-Charles together around the issues of living conditions, democratic life and neighbourhood development to strengthen the social fabric and bring out new points of view on the development of Pointe-Saint-Charles.
activities: Citizen meetings, citizen participation in borough council sittings, public meetings, research, recommendations and popularization on the main issues in the neighbourhood.

description: Support individuals and families, especially during periods of vulnerability, by promoting empowerment, building self-reliance and offering preventive, educational and therapeutic services.

description: Improve the quality of life and promote the independence of anglophone seniors in east-end Montreal, while fostering self-help, caring and sharing, and offering them a place of belonging.
activities: Information and referral, day centre, home care for elderly shut-ins, continuing education, translation, volunteer involvement, pairing with students (intergenerational relations), educational, recreational and social activities emphasizing health.

description: Develop a strategy that will allow agency representatives to enhance their public presentations.

description: Improve the quality of life of families by breaking their isolation, promoting their social integration and building their self-reliance.

description: In Montreal's west end, prevent children aged 9 to 13 from dropping out of school and encourage youth in difficulty aged 13 to 20 to resume their education. Help them rebuild relationships with their families, schools and communities by fostering self-sufficiency, self-esteem, mutual aid, respect and self-discipline.
